docs.lead_paragraph: Both Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan are implying that the Affordable Care Act would eviscerate Medicare when in fact the law should shore up the program.
docs.abstract: Editorial rebuts many of the false accusations Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan have made about Pres Obama's plans for Medicare; contends that it is much more likely that a Democratic approach to Medicare is will reform the program effectively than a Republican approach.
docs.snippet: Both Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan are implying that the Affordable Care Act would eviscerate Medicare when in fact the law should shore up the program.

docs.lead_paragraph: As a young community organizer in Chicago, Barack Obama concluded that to make a real difference, he needed to gain power. But did he actually make a difference?

headline.seo: Roseland, Where Obama the Politician Was Born
headline.main: What Does Obama Really Believe In?
headline.print_headline: The Birthplace of Obama the Politician

docs.abstract: Sub-prime Chicago neighborhood of Roseland, where a young Barack Obama worked as a community organizer, still suffers from high rates of poverty; neighborhood is a reminder that despite all the actions taken to ease the burden of the poor by the Obama administration, poverty seems to have receded as a national issue; administration says reason for shift in priorities was the economic crisis they inherited.
docs.snippet: As a young community organizer in Chicago, Barack Obama concluded that to make a real difference, he needed to gain power. But did he actually make a difference?

docs.lead_paragraph: Changing a strongly held belief has little to do with actual facts.
docs.abstract: Maggie Koerth-Baker article cites research examining the way emotions and attitudes interact; compares findings to the way in which some politicians, particularly Mitt Romney and Pres Obama, can change their minds about where they stand on important issues.
docs.snippet: Changing a strongly held belief has little to do with actual facts.

docs.lead_paragraph: COST TO RENT $2,040 a month, for a one-bedroom (with a loft) in an elevator doorman building in Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn .COST TO BUY $2,100 a month, including common charge and taxes, for a one-bedroom (with a loft) in a fourth-floor walk-up in Park Slope South.
docs.abstract: New Yorkers trying to decide whether to continue renting or become homeowners include David and Leslie Lucas of Brooklyn, who bought a one-bedroom apartment in Park Slope South for $470,000 after years of living in Carroll Gardens rental for $2,040 a month; couple will be paying slightly more in monthly carrying costs than they had been in their rental, but they ultimately expect to save. Photos (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: A special session of lawmakers ended without a resolution to the problem of the state’s unfunded pension liability which, at more than $83 billion, is the worst in the country.

headline.main: Illinois Legislators Fail to Agree on Pension Package
headline.print_headline: Illinois Legislators Fail to Agree on Pension Package

docs.abstract: Illinois lawmakers fail to reach agreement on a pension package aimed at addressing the state's unfunded pension liability, which, at more than $83 billion, is the worst in the country.

docs.lead_paragraph: The auto insurer Progressive may have done everything wrong in a lawsuit that became a cause célèbre on social media this week, but there’s a lesson for us all in the details.

headline.seo: Progressive’s Side of the Insurance Case That Blew Up on the Internet
headline.main: The Auto Insurance Case That Blew Up on the Internet
headline.print_headline: An Insurance Case That Flooded the Net

docs.abstract: Ron Lieber Your Money column explores lawsuit in which the car insurance company Progressive sent a lawyer to help defend the driver of a car who had killed Katie Fisher, its policyholder, in an accident; notes public anger over incident quickly spread after the deceased's brother, Matt, posted about it on Tumblr; says incident is a good opportunity for consumers to review the terms of their own liability insurance.
docs.snippet: The auto insurer Progressive may have done everything wrong in a lawsuit that became a cause célèbre on social media this week, but there’s a lesson for us all in the details.
